boardgame.name: 218高地之戰
The Battle for Hill 218
boardgame.description: The Battle for Hill 218 is a card-based strategy game in which two players fight to control a hill by occupying bases on the opposite sides._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players must maintain supply lines and destroy enemy units to advance on the enemy home base, while ensuring that their own base is not taken. Air strikes can aid your assault or help defend your base, but spend them wisely...you only have two._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Your Move Games (YMG 022) Hill 218 looks just like any other hill on your map, but High Command says it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s important and it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s your job to take it. Unfortunately the enemy has the same plan.
What You Get
The Battle for Hill 218 is an abstract strategy card game for two players, taking 15 - 30 minutes to play. It’s easy to learn but has a depth of strategy usually found only in games that take an hour or more to play. The deck box comes with everything needed to play: two army decks, two pairs of Air Strikes, the Hill 218 card and the rulebook.

Your Move Games (YMG 022) Hill 218 looks just like any other hill on your map, but High Command says it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s important and it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s your job to take it. Unfortunately the enemy has the same plan.
What You Get
The Battle for Hill 218 is an abstract strategy card game for two players, taking 15 - 30 minutes to play. It’s easy to learn but has a depth of strategy usually found only in games that take an hour or more to play. The deck box comes with everything needed to play: two army decks, two pairs of Air Strikes, the Hill 218 card and the rulebook.
Basics of Play
You begin play with the Hill 218 card in play and two face-up air strikes set off to the side of play. One side of the hill is your home base; the other is your opponent_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s. You win the game by occupying both bases; if neither player manages this, the player with the most units remaining when all units and air strikes have been played wins.
You will deploy unit cards, such as Tanks, Infantry and Heavy Weapons, onto the board. In order to advance you will need to maintain supply lines and do battle with enemy units blocking your path.
Who would enjoy The Battle for Hill 218?
Hill 218 has the simplicity and quick play of a perfect filler game, but has a lot of strategic depth as well. The Your Move Games team still breaks it out every chance we get (especially Darwin and Chad who play pretty much any time they have a deck and fifteen minutes handy).
English version. NEW 2nd Printing !

Who would enjoy The Battle for Hill 218? Hill 218 has the simplicity and quick play of a perfect filler game, but has a lot of strategic depth as well. The Your Move Games team still breaks it out every chance we get (especially Darwin and Chad who play pretty much any time they have a deck and fifteen minutes handy).
